titles.title: Reforming Amtrak's Inefficient Lines Act of 2005
To provide for certain cost cutting measures for Amtrak.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Railroads.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary: 11/2/2005--Introduced. Reforming Amtrak's Inefficient Lines Act of 2005 - Directs Amtrak, in order to cut costs, to: (1) discontinue service on the Southwest Chief, California Zephyr, Empire Builder, Coast Starlight, and Silver Star routes; (2) discontinue food and beverage service unless revenues from such service exceed service costs; and (3) eliminate sleeper cars, dining cars, lounge seating, checked baggage service, and onboard entertainment.
